Message.Text: Bakerloo Line: A 10 minute service is operating between Elephant & Castle and Queen's Park. A 30 minute service is operating between Queen's Park and Harrow & Wealdstone due to operational restrictions. Public transport should only be used for essential journeys. Bakerloo Line: A 10 minute service is operating between Elephant & Castle and Queen's Park. A 30 minute service is operating between Queen's Park and Harrow & Wealdstone due to operational restrictions. Public transport should only be used for essential journeys. Bakerloo Line: A 10 minute service is operating between Elephant & Castle and Queen's Park. A 30 minute service is operating between Queen's Park and Harrow & Wealdstone due to operational restrictions. Public transport should only be used for essential journeys.

Central Line: A 20 minute service is operating between Hainault to Woodford and between West Ruislip to North Acton. A 15 minute service is operating between Leytonstone and Epping and between Hainault and Ealing Broadway due to operational restrictions. Public transport should only be used for essential journeys.
CIRCLE LINE: No service until further notice due to operational restrictions. Circle Line: No service due to operational restrictions.

District Line: A 15 minute service between Upminster and Kensington (Olympia). A 20 minute service between Wimbledon and Edgware Road. A 20 minute service between High Street Kensington and Richmond / Ealing Broadway due to operational restrictions. Public transport should only be used for essential journeys.
Hammersmith and City Line: A 15 minute service is operating due to operational restrictions. Public transport should only be used for essential journeys.
Jubilee Line: A 10 minute service is operating due to operational restrictions. Public transport should only be used for essential journeys.

Metropolitan Line: A 15 minute service is operating between Baker Street and Watford and between Aldgate and Uxbridge. A 30 minute service is operating between Harrow-on-the-Hill and Amersham / Chesham and between Chesham and Watford. Public transport should only be used for essential journeys.
Northern Line: A 10 minute service is operating due to operational restrictions. Public transport should only be used for essential journeys.

Piccadilly Line: A 12 minute service is operating between Cockfosters and Heathrow Airport. A 20 minute service is operating between Acton town and Rayners Lane due to operation restrictions. Public transport should only be used for essential journeys.
Victoria Line: An 8 minute service is operating due to operational restrictions. Public transport should only be used for essential journeys.
WATERLOO & CITY LINE: No service until further notice due to operational restrictions. Waterloo and City Line: No service due to operational restrictions.

Status.Text: Part Closure, Special Service, Part Suspended, Service Closed

Message.Text: LONDON OVERGROUND: Monday 23 March until further notice, no service between Surrey Quays and New Cross. Please use New Cross Gate station instead. Public transport should only be used for essential journeys. LONDON OVERGROUND: Good Friday 10, Saturday 11, Easter Sunday 12 and Monday 13 April, no service between Sydenham and Crystal Palace. On Good Friday, Saturday and Monday, use Southern Railway for trains from Sydenham to Crystal Palace. On Sunday, please use local buses between Anerley and Crystal Palace or Southern Railway trains between Crystal Palace and Norwood Junction. There is no Night Overground service until further notice. London Overground: A significantly reduced service is operating on all London Overground lines with frequency halved to most destinations. Also, there is no service between Surrey Quays and New Cross. No service between Gospel Oak and Barking, and between Edmonton Green and Cheshunt due to planned engineering work. Public Transport should only be used for essential journeys. LONDON OVERGROUND: Saturday 11 and Sunday 12 April, no service between Edmonton Green and Cheshunt. Replacement bus Service L2 operate calling at Bush Hill Park, Southbury, Turkey Street and Theobalds Grove. LONDON OVERGROUND: Saturday 11 and Sunday 12 April, no service between Gospel Oak and Barking. Replacement buses operate between Walthamstow Central and Barking. Use London Buses and London Underground Victoria line connections between Gospel Oak, South Tottenham, Seven Sisters and Walthamstow Central.

A 30 minute service is operating between Paddington and Heathrow Airport / Reading. A 15 minute service is operating between Liverpool Street and Shenfield due to operational restrictions. Public transport should only be used for essential journeys.
Docklands Light Railway: A 10 minute service is operating due to operational restrictions. Public transport should only be used for essential journeys.
London Tramlink: A 15 minute service is operating due to operational restrictions. Public transport should only be used for essential journeys.

HARROW AND WEALDSTONE STATION: Saturday 11 until Friday 17 April, no step-free access between northbound London Northwestern Railway and Southern platform 5 and footbridge. This will also affect any southbound London NorthWestern Railway and Southern services which use platform 4 at times of service disruption, although these services usually use platform 6.
MARBLE ARCH STATION: No down escalator until further notice.
WOOLWICH ARSENAL DLR STATION: The Greens End / Bedford Square entrance is closed until further notice, please use the Woolwich New Road entrance instead.

BLACKHORSE ROAD STATION: Closed due to operational reasons.
PRINCE REGENT STATION: Closed until further notice due to operational restrictions.

LONDON BRIDGE STATION: Please note that step free interchange between the Jubilee and Northern lines is partly at street level, in both directions. Lifts are available between Northern line and Borough High Street entrance then via Borough High Street, St Thomas Street and Joiner Street to the main Underground ticket hall from where lifts are available to/from the Jubilee line.
Cambridge Heath Station: Not served by trains to/from Chingford
London Fields Station: Not served by trains to/from Chingford
Emerson Park Station: A limited service runs on this branch.
Turnham Green Station: Served by Piccadilly line trains until 06:50 Mondays to Saturdays, until 07:45 Sundays and after 22:30 every evening. At other times use the District line
Until Spring 2020, the station car park at Chingford will be closed

ILFORD STATION: From Wednesday 29 January until late 2020, the Cranbrook Road entrance will be closed whilst a new station entrance is built. A temporary entrance will open in Ilford Hill and the existing York Mews entrance will open throughout the day.

HARROW AND WEALDSTONE STATION: Between Saturday 21 March and Friday 17 April Network Rail will be carrying out planned maintenance on each of the lifts at this station, one at a time. If you use the lifts or require step-free access please use the contact details below to speak to a Customer Service advisor who can help you plan your journey. For journeys starting on London Underground or London Overground call 0343 222 1234. *Service and network charges may apply. See tfl.gov.uk/terms for details. For journeys starting on National Rail call 0800 0223720
MARBLE ARCH STATION: No down escalator until further notice.
HANWELL STATION: From Sunday 5 April, the station will now be open on Sundays.
CANNING TOWN STATION: Please enter the station via Silvertown Way and exit the station via the bus station.
STRATFORD STATION: Please enter the station via the Northern ticket hall by Westfield and exit the station via the Southern ticket hall next to the bus station.

WALTHAMSTOW CENTRAL UNDERGROUND STATION: Please enter the station via the London Overground ticket hall in Station Approach by the car park and exit the station via the stairs or lift into the bus station. The Selborne Road ticket hall is closed.
SEVEN SISTERS UNDERGROUND STATION: Please enter and exit the station via the London Overground entrance in Seven Sisters Road. The High Road entrance is closed.

FINSBURY PARK STATION: Please enter the station via the western ticket hall on Goodwin Street, off Fonthill Road, and exit the station via Station Place by the Arsenal store and bus station. The Seven Sisters Road subway is closed.

Victoria: During escalator refurbishment works a one-way system will be in place. Access to enter, exit or change between lines will be available, but a one-way system will be in place and if you are familiar with the station you may find your walking route changes. Extra staff will be available to assist you, so please listen for announcements, follow the signs and allow longer for your journey, especially at peak times. Step-free access to the entire station will be available as usual.
Camden Town: On weekends, a one-way system will be in operation at Camden Town. Access to the platforms will be via the spiral staircase, which has 96 steps.
Camden Town: On weekends, a one-way system will be in operation at Camden Town. Access to the platforms will be via the spiral staircase, which has 96 steps.

Bank Station: During Night Tube operating hours, Exits 6 (Lombard Street/King William Street), 8 (Walbrook/Queen Victoria Street) and 9 (Cheapside/Poultry) and the entrance in Walbrook will be closed.

Bank Station: During Night Tube operating hours, Exits 6 (Lombard Street/King William Street), 8 (Walbrook/Queen Victoria Street) and 9 (Cheapside/Poultry) and the entrance in Walbrook will be closed.

Northolt: During work to install a lift and bridge to provide step-free access, there will be a hoarding on the platform. Please move down the platform away from the stairs, where you will find it easier to board the train. During weekday evening peaks, you will find it easier to exit from a westbound train at this station if you travel in one of the front three carriages

Hanger Lane: During work to install a lift and bridge to provide step-free access, there will be a hoarding on the platform. Please move down the platform away from the stairs, where you will find it easier to board the train. During weekday evening peaks, you will find it easier to exit from a westbound train at this station if you travel in one of the front three carriages
From 07:00 Friday 10 until 23:00 Monday 20 April, the station car park at Finchley Central will be closed.
From 22:00 Thursday 9 until 18:00 Tuesday 14 April, the station car park at Colindale will be closed.

Paddington: No Step Free Access - Step free access is not available between the National Rail station and the Circle and District line platforms until June due to planned maintenance. Call us on 0343 222 1234 if you need help planning your journey.

Custom House for ExCel: No Step Free Access - Step free access is not available to/from Victoria Dock Road due to a faulty lift. Step free access to/from the ExCeL Exhibition Centre is still available. Call us on 0343 222 1234 if you need more information.
